item.description:
This event is for everyone, kaykers will b on the water catching the over fattened
Simsbury river rats for our dinner, non kayakers will be fishing for other things the rich simsbury people have left behind, like the food filled coolers left in the park after the little snot faced kids are done playing...althoug they might be filled with veggie burgers, energy drinks..bare salad..and quishe..

This Kayak Put in is easy to drive up to, seems secluded enough for a dinner and wine event

The location is called Curtis Park, a socker, baseball fields and that kind of place, but on the river side there is a dirt road leading towards the river where there is a put in area..

You will get to see the beginning of the Tarriffville George..
bring some food and favourite beverage...


Getting There:
from hartford direction:
91 north to exit 36,
Take left (west direction) on to 178 (park ave) toward bloomfield for 1.6 miles.
At intersection take right onto 187 (north direction) (blue hills ave) for about 5 miles heading toward tariffville direction.
You will meet rte 187/189,
Stay on 189 to Tarriffville..at the end of the nice paved part you will end up in tariffville, take a left at the light onto rte 315 (elm st) follow it to the end at the stop sign take the left into Tarrifville road (the street sign says Withrop, thats the raod to the right though)..continue on 315 for about 1.2 miles, take a right into Curtis Park (right side) and go to the river via the dirt road..

ok if you use Mapquest, GPs or other..there is 2 Tariffville roads in the town and the numbers dont match right....
so just look at your map for Curtis Park..based the decriptors given above..
its near rte 315 and 202 intersection for a secondary land mark.

other info and map picture:
http://connecticut.qu....

I will leave from work directly and should be there about 5:30 +/-
You get there when you get there...slow pokes will b left on their own...
to go down the George....we wil say a prayor for you with a sip of your wine as you go down to the end
